Co-authored-by: Filippo A. E. Nuccio <filippo.nuccio@univ-st-etienne.fr>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [6ac8a7fa93](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15733/commits/6ac8a7fa93e844f37af09a63f361f968d4c46a21)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Ring.Subring.IntPolynomial`|916|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Polynomial.int`
`+ int_coeff_eq`
`+ int_eval₂_eq`
`+ int_leadingCoeff_eq`
`+ int_monic_iff`
`+ int_natDegree`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

One advantage is that for short `P` the total expression is shorter than `intPolynomial R hp`. And also, the user is visually reminded of the `P`, which would otherwise only be available via hovering etc...

> What do you think of:
> 
>     1. Moving this file to some folder about (sub)rings? (If so, please update the PR title)
> 
>     2. Renaming to `Polynomial.int`, and making `P` explicit, so that dot-notation can be used?

I have implemented both changes.

:v: mariainesdff can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10900694079/job/30248865592)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10900694079/job/30248865891)

Thnanks!

bors d+

I am happy with 1. but concerning 2. I am a bit sceptical. The hypothesis `hP` that all coefficients are in `R` would be needed anyhow, so unless we create a structure `intPolynomial` we would at any rate end up with something like `P.int R hP`, and at this point I do not see the advantage of dot notation.

Am I right that this entire file can be generalized from `v.valuationSubring` to an arbitrary `S : Subring K`?
The name could suggestively remain the same... or maybe something like `subPolynomial` or `resPolynomial`. But I don't really like either of those...

Good point, I generalize everything to an arbitrary subring, keeping the same name. After some thoughts, I believe that keeping `R` explicit is better, otherwise I believe that typeclass inference would struggle too much.

What do you think of:

1. Moving this file to some folder about (sub)rings? (If so, please update the PR title)
2. Renaming to `Polynomial.int`, and making `P` explicit, so that dot-notation can be used?

I am happy with 1. but concerning 2. I am a bit sceptical. The hypothesis `hP` that all coefficients are in `R` would be needed anyhow, so unless we create a structure `intPolynomial` we would at any rate end up with something like `P.int R hP`, and at this point I do not see the advantage of dot notation.

Thnanks!

bors d+

```suggestion
def Polynomial.int (P : K[X]) (hP : ∀ n : ℕ, P.coeff n ∈ R) : R[X] where
  toFinsupp :=
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem int_coeff_eq  (n : ℕ) : ↑((P.int R hP).coeff n) = P.coeff n := rfl

@[simp]
theorem int_leadingCoeff_eq : ↑(P.int R hP).leadingCoeff = P.leadingCoeff := rfl

@[simp]
theorem int_monic_iff : (P.int R hP).Monic ↔ P.Monic := by
  rw [Monic, Monic, ← int_leadingCoeff_eq, OneMemClass.coe_eq_one]

@[simp]
theorem int_natDegree : (P.int R hP).natDegree = P.natDegree := rfl

variable {L : Type*} [Field L] [Algebra K L]

@[simp]
theorem int_eval₂_eq (x : L) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Ring/Subring/IntPolynomiall): add intPolynomial

Am I right that this entire file can be generalized from `v.valuationSubring` to an arbitrary `S : Subring K`?
The name could suggestively remain the same... or maybe something like `subPolynomial` or `resPolynomial`. But I don't really like either of those...

Good point, I generalize everything to an arbitrary subring, keeping the same name. After some thoughts, I believe that keeping `R` explicit is better, otherwise I believe that typeclass inference would struggle too much.

What do you think of:

I am happy with 1. but concerning 2. I am a bit sceptical. The hypothesis `hP` that all coefficients are in `R` would be needed anyhow, so unless we create a structure `intPolynomial` we would at any rate end up with something like `P.int R hP`, and at this point I do not see the advantage of dot notation.

One advantage is that for short `P` the total expression is shorter than `intPolynomial R hp`. And also, the user is visually reminded of the `P`, which would otherwise only be available via hovering etc...
